snippet: The federal highway safety agency said that the driver of a Tesla on “autopilot” died in a crash in May, thought to be the first death in a self-driving car....
abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration reveals that Joshua Brown of Ohio died in motor vehicle accident on Florida highway in May after his Tesla Model S electric sedan, in self-driving mode, failed to apply brakes and hit tractor trailer; is first known fatal accident involving vehicle using autopilot.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and NEAL E. BOUDETTE
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi, Alain Delaqueriere and Christopher Drew contributed reporting from New York, and John Ismay from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: The federal highway safety agency said that the driver of a Tesla on “autopilot” died in a crash in May, thought to be the first death in a self-driving car.

headline.main: Self-Driving Tesla Was Involved in Fatal Crash, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: A Tesla Driver  Using Autopilot  Dies in a Crash
